channel.title: Google pays outside researchers of potentially found flaws in Chrome
channel.description:
"In 2011, Google has paid more than $120,000 to outside researchers for finding Chrome flaws, Computerworld said." [[url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/44249386/ns/technology_and_science-security/]link[/url]]
Discuss.

item.title: Google pays outside researchers of potentially found flaws in Chrome
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:22, topic:411829”][quote author=Niall link=topic=513086.msg3726947#msg3726947 date=1314325391]

Based on the history of this forum any time money is used by big companies to get people to do something greed comes up in the topic.

*sigh
[/quote]
because we’re all crazy commies, frell![/quote]

hey comrade maybe we should reform the soviet union once more! we will show those capitalistic pigs who is boss!

Read full topic

item.source: Google pays outside researchers of potentially found flaws in Chrome

item.title: Google pays outside researchers of potentially found flaws in Chrome
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Greeny:

In reply to Mopman I think tL hit the nail on the head there. One thing I’ve never understood is why these software firms don’t hire more “hackers”, surely most of them do it out of boredom, or lack of a job either way I don’t see why the companies don’t just offer fixed sums of cash out to the people who would normally exploit or sell on. It’s certainly a good counter, even if it didn’t work the criminals would have to pay out at least more than the legitimate offer.

But the people who are getting the payouts are not “criminals”. Or at least, they’re not the cc thieves, botnet operators etc. of the world.

Read full topic
item.source: Google pays outside researchers of potentially found flaws in Chrome

People can’t comprehend it.

item.title: Google pays outside researchers of potentially found flaws in Chrome
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Frell:

no IIRC someone here made a post about greed effecting humans or something a while back

and that is relevant to this how? google is paying an independent company/person for a service, there is nothing wrong with that company/person receiving money for said service, and considering how vital this service is there’s nothing wrong with google paying out the ass for this service

money is a motivator and it isn’t necessarily greedy to want money for a service

item.source: Google pays outside researchers of potentially found flaws in Chrome

item.title: Google pays outside researchers of potentially found flaws in Chrome
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Mopman:

It’s not like the people they are paying are the same people who would “use theses flaws to make money”, though. Even if it were, the money they’re paying is fuck all compared to what they’d get off a good 0day.

Perhaps, but maybe it is a nice legitimate incentive to not sell it on to someone else who may use it for something a little less legitimate.

Read full topic
item.source: Google pays outside researchers of potentially found flaws in Chrome

IN B4 GREED AND HUMANITY IS BROKEN
